results.title: History in action
results.creator_credit: Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: History, when viewed with hindsight, has the aura of inevitability. This series reviews key events of the 20th Century and examines the reaction to these events as they actually occurred. Each programme uses original material such as newspapers, photographs, archival footage, cartoons and music to enhance the contemporary feel.

results.title: His worship, Mr Montreal
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, Marrin Canell, Robert Duncan, James de B. Domville and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A fascinating and spirited portrait of the life and times of the legendary Camillien Houde. Using rare archival footage and recent interviews with ex-colleagues, aides and friends, the film presents a comprehensive profile of this incredible, and, to some, infamous, man.

results.title: His trust; His trust fulfilled
results.brief_description: This melodrama, set during and after the Civil War, is something of a sketch for ‘Birth of a Nation’. Against Griffith’s wishes it was released serially in two parts. In the first part, a faithful black servant, played by a white actor in black face, rescues his master’s child from the burning house. Her father has died fighting for the South. In the second part the old servant after using all his savings, is tempted to steal to pay for the young woman’s education. Cast includes Wilfred Lucas, Claire McDowell, Mack Sennett, Del Henderson, Gladys Egan.

results.title: His mother's voice
results.brief_description: Using as its source a radio interview from the ABCs current affairs program, The World Today, in which a Queensland mother recounts how she came to learn of her sons shooting in 1995, Dennis Tupicoff explores terrain somewhere between documentary and animation. As an animator he gives an added dimension to the documentary nature of his subject matter by dividing the film into two halves, one an animated re-enactment of the crime, the other an understated lyrical and visual poetic presentation of the overwhelming nature of grief. This short film is both compelling and powerfully affecting.

results.title: His fighting chance
results.brief_description: An account of the assistance being given to victims of poliomyelitis, showing techniques of medicine and rehabilitation schemes through which patients help to cure themselves.

results.title: Hiroshima & Nagasaki: the harvest of nuclear war
results.creator_credit: Masami Hayakawa, Naoyuki Jinnouchi and Iwanami Productions
results.brief_description: Outlines the horrific effects of the two atomic bombs dropped on the small cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki in August 1945. With the aid of some contemporary footage, the film shows the devastating psychological and physiological results on the populace, both immediately and in the following months and years after the war. Includes footage of a visit by Pope John Paul II. Also mentions the huge stockpiling of thousands of far larger bombs in the decades since World War II.

results.title: Hiroko Ikoko
results.brief_description: Two little Japanese girls go for a stroll after school to look for beautiful tropical fish which they had been studying and drawing in school. Their search leads them to the pools of a formal garden and to the glass aquariums of street markets. Their parents, who have become anxious over their prolonged absence, go searching and find them. Many glimpses of Tokyo are seen.

results.title: Hinkler: the aviator
results.creator_credit: John Armstrong, Penny Spence, EBU and Nine Network
results.brief_description: Bert Hinkler became an Australian hero and is remembered as one of the world’s greatest avaitors. His record-breaking solo flight from England to Australia in 1928 was completed in 15 days reducing the original record by half. People wore Hinkler hats, Hinkler flowers, ate Hinkler puddings and had Hinkler dances as part of the excitement following this achievement. The program recreates scenes and uses archival footage to bring to life not only one of the greatest pioneers in aviation, but also a period of our history.

results.title: Hinchinbrook diary
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An unobtrusive look at the farming community of Hinchinbrook, Quebec and its timeless lifestyle. The camera moves quietly through the lives of people busy doing what they have always done.
